intro: Zizia aptera var. occidentalis, commonly known as western winged milkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, often in regions with well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, wing-like appearance on the upper surface, giving it its common name. Zizia aptera var. occidentalis is also known for its role in supporting pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
